item.title: Pokemon Legends Z-A: All Poke Ball Types & Where to Buy Them
item.description:
Pokemon Legends: Z-A has changed the way Pokemon games work, but one of the main aspects of the franchise remains the same. Of course, we are talking about Poke Balls, which come in a wide variety, and each of them has a particular effect that helps trainers catch the most elusive species that have made their homes in Lumiose City.

Learn everything you need to know about Poke Balls with our comprehensive guide, which includes information on how to get every type of Poke Ball in the game, what they do, and where to buy more.

All Poke Ball Types & Where to Find Them in Pokemon Legends Z-A

Poke Balls are the essential tool every trainer should carry to make the most out of their journey through Lumiose City. Poke Balls can be purchased in every Pokemon Center in Lumiose, from Nurse Joy, though if players want more specialized tools to catch Pokemon, they should visit the Poke Ball Boutique . The location of this store is detailed on the map above .

However, there are special Poke Balls that can only be obtained following certain requisites. Here's every Poke Ball-type in the game, and where to find them:

Poke Ball Type

Effect

Where to Buy/Find

Poke Ball

Catches Pokemon with the lowest success rate

Pokemon Centers - Poke Ball Boutique

Great Ball

Catches Pokemon with an intermediate success rate

Pokemon Centers - Poke Ball Boutique

Ultra Ball

Catches Pokemon with the highest success rate

Pokemon Centers - Poke Ball Boutique

Quick Ball

If used on the first turn, it raises the capture success rate significantly

Poke Ball Boutique - Common Loot

Fast Ball

If used on Pokemon with high levels of SPD, the success rate increases

Poke Ball Boutique - Common Loot

Lure Ball

If used on Pokemon while on the water, the catch success rate increases moderately

Poke Ball Boutique - Common Loot

Level Ball

More effective to catch Pokemon that are lower level than the trainer's

Poke Ball Boutique - Common Loot

Heavy Ball

Extremely effective on Pokemon with a weight of 440.9 lbs or more

Poke Ball Boutique - Rare Loot

Dive Ball

If used on Pokemon in or on the water, the catch success rate increases moderately

Poke Ball Boutique - Rare Loot

Net Ball

Moderately more effective when catching Bug or Water-type Pokemon

Poke Ball Boutique - Rare Loot

Luxury Ball

Pokemon caught in this Ball have their Friendship increase rate doubled

Poke Ball Boutique - Rare Loot - Mission Reward

Nest Ball

Extremely efficient at catching lower-level Pokemon

Poke Ball Boutique - Common Loot

Timer Ball

More effective the longer the battle has lasted (reaching maximum efficiency around round 30).

Poke Ball Boutique - Rare Loot - Mission Reward

Dusk Ball

Extremely effective at catching Pokemon in dark places (underground) or by night

Poke Ball Boutique - Rare Loot - Mission Reward

Master Ball

The definitive Ball, with 100% Success Rate

Reward for Mable's Research Rank 49

Premier Ball

A somewhat efficient ball with a success rate between a Poke Ball and a Great Ball

Reward for purchasing 10 items at the store

Repeat Ball

Greatly effective when capturing Pokemon already registered in the Pokedex

Poke Ball Boutique - Common Loot

Heal Ball

Fully heals the Pokemon caught inside this ball

Poke Ball Boutique - Rare Loot

How to Use Poke Balls in Pokemon Legends Z-A

To use Poke Balls in Pokemon Legends Z-A , trainers need to have at least one of the mentioned items in their inventory, and then approach a Pokemon. Using ZL players will aim , then hitting ZR will release the ball and hit the Pokemon.

Trainers will have higher chances of capturing Pokemon if they weaken them first , which will leave a certain window of opportunity (3.5 seconds approx) to catch them. This window of opportunity is represented by the swirling stars effect (similar to confusion), and after only one try, the Pokemon weakened in this way will flee .

Players can also sneak on Pokemon to catch them by surprise , by launching a Ball before they can engage in combat or flee. Some Pokemon like Abra (which uses Teleport to flee) can only be caught by surprise. The Quick Ball is the best ball for this method, as it has the highest chances of success while catching Pokemon in the first turn, and sneak throws are considered to be turn 0 .

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: New Arcade-Style Game with 'Very Positive' Reviews Is Free to Play on Steam
item.description:
Zaccaria Pinball is a new arcade-style Steam game that recently left early access, offering a free experience for retro game fans. Many pinball games on Steam aim to replicate the thrill of hitting high scores on an arcade machine. Zaccaria Pinball , however, goes further by reviving a largely forgotten legacy.

As arcade machines have mostly become a thing of the past, many developers have tried to preserve them by turning them into video games. A particularly nostalgic example is Full Tilt! Pinball , which many PC gamers may remember from earlier versions of Microsoft Windows or macOS. The list of arcade-style games continues to grow, with numerous new titles trying to carry the legacy onto modern platforms. One such game is Zaccaria Pinball , which was released recently and is already gaining attention from retro game enthusiasts.

Zaccaria Pinball Is an Arcade-Style Game with Free-to-Play Tables

According to Zaccaria Pinball 's Steam page, the game offers several free-to-play modes, including Time Machine, along with a collection of nostalgic pinball tables. The game was released on October 16 to very positive reviews from Steam users, though it had been in early access for some time. Players looking to access the full experience, with all tables and game modes unlocked, will need to purchase some of its DLCs. However, this additional content doesn't seem necessary to enjoy the thrill of arcade-style gameplay in Zaccaria Pinball .

Some of the interesting features Zaccaria Pinball offers include a global leaderboard, allowing serious pinball game fans to compete against each other, and detailed customization options to personalize tables. The game is also inspired by the Zaccaria brand, a legendary pinball manufacturer from the 90s. Known as one of the world's largest pinball producers, Zaccaria created some of the most sought-after tables, several of which are recreated in Zaccaria Pinball as a tribute to the company's influence on the industry.

Zaccaria Pinball also lets players tweak some of its physics-based settings to create unique pinball experiences. It includes physics presets that create different game modes, such as Arcade and Simulation. One of the best aspects of the game is its support for local co-op modes, allowing teams of up to four players to complete challenges together. Additionally, Zaccaria Pinball offers a VR mode for a more immersive experience and is compatible with the Steam Deck for those wanting a retro-style game on the go. However, the VR mode is sold separately as a DLC, priced at around $15 USD.

item.title: Pokemon Legends Z-A: All Wild Zone 5 Pokemon
item.description:
Wild Zone 5 in Pokemon Legends: Z-A has a total of seven Pokemon players can catch. Finding all seven of these Pokemon can be a bit tricky if players don’t know how to get rid of the purple sludgy mass that blocks certain routes within this area. Luckily, the process becomes fairly simple once you know what to do.

This guide covers all seven Pokemon locations that can be found in Wild Zone 5, as well as how to reach those locations without getting sidetracked. Here’s the breakdown.

All Wild Zone 5 Pokemon in Pokémon Legends: Z-A & Where to Find Them

There are seven Pokemon in Wild Zone 5 in Legends: Z-A . They are:

  • Bellsprout
  • Pidgey
  • Bunnelby
  • Venipede
  • Abra
  • Electrike
  • Pidgeotto

Bellsprout Location

Multiple Bellsprout can be found roaming the main road running through the middle of Wild Zone 5.

Pidgey Location

Pidgey can be found near the Bellsprout, sitting on top of taxis, lamp posts, and umbrella stands .

Bunnelby Location

You’ll find multiple Bunnelby directly to the left of the Wild Zone 5 entrance , in the bushes.

Venipede Location

A few Venipede occupy the same area as the Bunnelby , to the left of the entrance.

Abra Location

Abra are found on the rooftops . To get to them, you’ll need to go behind the Venipede and Bunnelby garden and walk across the shallow pool to reach the area behind the building. Drop down at the spot where the pool turns into a small waterfall. Walk up the stone footpath that leads up to a higher platform and use the ladder to climb up to the roof.

Electrike Location

Electrike can be found in the area blocked off by the purple goo sludge , directly next to the place where you drop down from the pool. Use a Water or Psychic-type attack to wash away the purple goo and go through the tunnel to the other side. Ignore the Venipedes and Whirlipede and turn left to find a ladder that leads to the rooftops where you can find Electrike.

Pidgeotto Location

A few Pidgeotto can be found directly next to the Electrikes that roam the small garden on the rooftops.

Alpha Pokemon Location

There are two guaranteed Alpha Pokemon that spawn in Wild Zone 5.

  • An Alpha Bellsprout spawns opposite the fruit stand on the main road in front of the entrance.
  • An Alpha Whirlipede spawns just past the tunnel blocked by the purple sludge.

Alpha Pokemon only start appearing after you’ve completed the “A Big Ol’ Bunnelby” side mission in Legends: Z-A .

4.1 /10

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: Best 4X Games For Becoming Overpowered
item.description:
The whole point of 4X is to get so far ahead that players can lose half their empire to a rampaging AI and still win. Power-tripping is the most honest 4X experience, and some games make it easier (and funnier) than others. Some of them practically beg players to abuse their systems in the pursuit of exploration, expansion, exploitation, and extermination.

These 4X games are all about power fantasies, transforming players into veritable gods among men once all is said and done.

Master Of Orion 2: Battle At Antares

Overpowered Traits

Master of Orion II: Battle at Antares

Released
November 22, 1996
Platform(s)
MS-DOS, PC
Powered by

Master of Orion 2 ’s empire customization is robust enough that going hog wild is an easy affair. The trait system is the main offender here, offering combinations that can make domination trivial. The Creative trait alone is a notorious meme: players can research every single technology in a branch, turning what’s supposed to be a balanced rock-paper-scissors system into something entirely one-sided. Fans can stack custom race picks and, later, leverage multi-species populations for growth and farming bonuses.

Combat, meanwhile, is a playground for anyone who ever wanted to build their own Death Star and outfit it with planet-killing weapons like the Stellar Converter. The game wants things to go off the rails, and that’s the beauty of it!

Sid Meier’s Alpha Centauri

Exploiting Social Engineering & Tech

Sid Meier's Alpha Centauri
4X
Strategy
Released
February 9, 1999

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

The real fun in Alpha Centauri is in discovering just how far its broken social engineering and wild tech tree can be pushed, granting plenty of opportunities to cheese one’s way to victory. Want to rush to Transcendence? Stack Research and Economy bonuses and spam Secret Projects. Prefer to run the map with an army of murder-fungus? Pick the Gaians (or Cult of Planet in Alien Crossfire ) for the best native-life synergy.

Even the "peaceful" Faction leaders have some exploit hiding in their playstyle, from the Morganites’ ability to buy almost anything they want, to the Gaians’ ability to summon worm swarms. The planet itself won’t keep up. Once players unlock late-game terraforming, they can erase oceans and build land bridges to every enemy capital.

Master Of Magic

Apocalyptic Power

Master of Magic

Released
December 13, 2022
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Master of Magic ’s approach to being overpowered is to let players summon and breed whatever army they want, then blast their enemies from orbit. The game’s custom wizard system is essentially an exploit menu in disguise. Min-maxing picks like Alchemy (turn gold into mana for free) and Warlord (everyone gets a promotion!) allow things to start snowballing immediately.

Once players hit the mid-game, they’re free to carpet the world with flying fortresses and apocalypse spells. The result is a power fantasy so shameless that fans can’t help but feel guilty. Well, maybe…

Galactic Civilizations 2

Abusing The Tech Trees

Galactic Civilizations II: Dread Lords
Released
February 27, 2006

Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

The tech tree in Galactic Civilizations 2 is a maze of abusable systems, where players can research their way to game-breaking economic engines and fleets that can outmaneuver any foe. The magic, however, is in the ship design. Players can build nearly invincible space hulks by stacking the right modules, or create tiny, cost-effective "missile boats" that can wipe out capital fleets.

Although the AI can be clever, it can’t handle a player who’s figured out how to build efficient starbase networks or exploit morale bonuses to supercharge their planet output. By the late game, players will be cranking out ships every turn and snatching up the galaxy’s resources like a bona fide pro.

Endless Legend

Resource Exploits

Endless Legend
4X
Strategy
Systems
Released
September 18, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

Endless Legend isn’t shy about letting players stamp the game with their own flavor of overpowered. Every faction in the game is fundamentally broken in one way or another. The Cultists can convert every neutral minor to their cause, Necrophages breed like locusts and harvest enemies, and Broken Lords don’t need food, turning what should be a critical limiter into a non-issue. The trait and research systems allow for endless stacking, too.

For example, players can specialize their cities to a point where a single tile can heal armies so fast that they become nearly unkillable. Once the "dust" economy is factored in and certain items and heroes are so strong that they turn one’s army into a rolling doomstack, it’s clear that the developers wanted them to break the game (and then break it again just to be sure).

Endless Space 2

Also Endless Spiraling...

Endless Space 2
Grand Strategy
4X
Systems
Released
October 6, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

The major factions in Endless Space 2 can all break the rules in some way. The Vodyani unceremoniously yoink population from everyone else, the Sophons unlock tech at physics-defying speeds, and the Unfallen can tie the map together with vine networks and turn every corner into their backyard. The modding community is well aware of how overpowered these systems can get, but even in the vanilla game, it’s easy to hit a tipping point where the economy spirals so hard the AI doesn’t know how to react anymore.

Chain the right heroes, ship modules, and planet improvements, and players will possess forces capable of obliterating enemy armadas in a single turn. The "endless" in the title basically refers to the list of ways fans can become OP.

Age Of Wonders 4

The AI Just Can’t Keep Up

Age Of Wonders 4
8.5 /10
Released
May 2, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

The customizable leader and faction builder in Age of Wonders 4 is like a playground. Players can combine culture traits, magical tomes, and racial perks in ways that the AI isn’t equipped to deal with effectively. The game’s Pantheon system encourages min-maxing, which culminates in more bonuses. Unlike some of the older Age of Wonders titles, this one leans fully into power fantasy.

Multiplayer might offer a compelling challenge, but against the computer, the fun is in seeing how many exploits can be strung together before the map runs out of viable opponents.

Distant Worlds 2

Automation Is Tough To Beat

Distant Worlds 2
Strategy
Systems
Released
March 10, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Most 4X games are about carefully managing a growing empire. Distant Worlds 2 is about controlling a galaxy so huge that players will rarely see all of it, and then bending it to their will with the help of an overpowered automation system. The sheer scale means that if being OP is the goal, they can turn off a few checks and let their colonies multiply like rabbits. The game’s quintessential exploit is that the player can micromanage only the fun stuff, while the AI handles all the boring logistics, except that the latter never gets tired.

When players want to take the reins, they can concentrate their best fleets, abuse tech-trading if it’s enabled, or exploit certain government types to secure a victory. Just identify the snowball moments and watch the economy suddenly dwarf the rest of the galaxy by several orders of magnitude!

Star Ruler 2

Growing Never Stops

  • Platform(s) : PC
  • Released : March 27, 2015
  • Developer(s) : Blind Mind Studios
  • Genre(s) : 4X, RTS

Star Ruler 2 isn’t for everyone, mostly because of its intimidating learning curve. The "Exponential" economic model means every advantage can be leveraged into runaway growth. Properly managed, a single early-game lead can become an empire so efficient that it can fund planet-scale superweapons every turn. Another highlight is the modular ship designer, which can result in gargantuan dreadnoughts.

Combine this with a card-based diplomacy system that can sabotage or subvert entire alliances with a lucky draw, and it’s possible to win a galaxy-wide war before the opponent knows it started. For the patient gamer, there’s almost no ceiling on what they can do.

Civilization 4

There Are Several Ways To Become The Master Of The Map

Sid Meier's Civilization 4
Strategy
Tactical
Systems
Released
October 25, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

The Civilization 4 civic system is famously abusable. Players can transition from cash-poor to rolling in gold in a startlingly short amount of time. Stack Great People, use the right Wonders, and players can leapfrog up the tech tree. Religion can be used to spread one’s faith early and transform the map in a few turns with missionaries and cathedrals.

The AI is pretty bad at adapting to the cheese, so once fans know how to set up a city for infinite specialists or how to catapult to space victory via Liberalism, there’s no looking back. Multiplayer is a different story as always, but solo Civ 4 is required playing for anyone who enjoys making history with a steamroller.

item.title: When is the Next Plants vs Brainrots Admin Abuse?
item.description:
Collecting the rarest Brainrots and Plants in Plants vs Brainrots is quite a challenge. Most of them spawn either extremely rarely or during specific events. Luckily, there's a way to fill your collection with the best units in under an hour. So, in this guide, we'll tell you when the next Plants vs Brainrots Admin Abuse event is.

Admin Abuse is one of the most anticipated events by players. This is unsurprising, as various events and boosters are activated on the server during it, albeit for a short time.

When is the Next Plants vs Brainrots Admin Abuse?

Events in Plants vs Brainrots spawn either after a certain amount of time or after certain conditions are met. Admin Abuse, however, has a specific schedule. Specifically, it activates an hour before the release of a new update. This allows players to stock up on rare units before trying out the new content.

The next Admin Abuse event in Plants vs Brainrots is scheduled for Saturday, October 18, 2025, at 11:00 AM (UTC+0) . This event often takes place on Saturdays, before major updates. However, the developers may occasionally run it on other days depending on circumstances. Therefore, we strongly recommend visiting the Plants vs Brainrots Discord server to stay informed about upcoming Admin Abuse events in advance.

What is the Admin Abuse Event in Plants vs Brainrots?

The reason the Admin Abuse event is the most popular in Plants vs Brainrots is quite simple. During this event, players have a chance to obtain both extremely rare Brainrots and Plants. This is because for an hour, the server goes into chaos with various events and the luck boosters.

Furthermore, while Admin Abuse is active, you can encounter extremely rare Brainrots and find equally rare seeds. So, we strongly recommend you prepare thoroughly.

Firstly, you should earn as much Cash as possible in Plants vs Brainrots . You'll need it to purchase rare seeds. We also recommend purchasing several seeds in advance and planting them during Admin Abuse to receive bonuses from weather events. Last but not least, consumables are important.

You'll want to stock up on Handcuffs, Tasers, and Frost Grenades. Sure, they're quite expensive, but they'll help you out significantly during the event. Admin Abuse spawns not only various events, but also the rarest Brainrots in Plants vs Brainrots . These often have huge HP pools, making them difficult to defeat. Using consumables will significantly slow them down, allowing your plants to do their job.

Roblox
446
8.8 /10
Released
September 1, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Teen / Diverse Content: Discretion Advised, In-Game Purchases (Includes Random Items), Users Interact
Platform(s)
PlayStation 4, Xbox One, PC, Android, iOS, Meta Quest 2, Meta Quest Pro
